card.name: ITHE: add srch01 back to the search pool
card.description:
h2. User Story
* The srch01 box fell over in production last month, so it was removed from the pool * SiteOps has rekickstarted the box, and said that it's ready to be included back in the pool. * Verify that the box is properly puppeted, configured, and added back to our host_roles for the next deployment.
h2. Dev Tasks (Keith 2013-04-11)
* Make sure the box is puppeted with the correct release branch. * Make sure that platform services is started. * Talk to Rob - he said that after the box is kickstarted and puppeted, the box needs to be restarted before endeca platform services behaves correctly. Make sure this happened. * Ensure that the srch01 box is back in the host_roles file * Let the deployment lead know that it's back in the pool so he/she can keep an eye on it on deploy night.

card.name: SV6 - Provide a way for BA's to get a failed request
card.description:
h2. User Story: As an OVE tester, I need to be able to create SV6 Sale Pending listings and when the issue is resolved, and I need to be able to test when the issue is resolved, so that I can see how the listing is displayed on all parts of the SV6 screens (buyer, seller, and Auctioneer). h2. Dev Notes (Keith 2013-03-12) * We need a way for BA's to get a failed request. Stubbing would probably be the best approach here. Work for this card should include enabling the stub for the dealer verify service, and if a specific account/contact is passed as a param (this account/contact identifier will be provided by a BA), then the service should return a "reject" response. Otherwise, it should respond normally (non-"reject"). %{color:red}BA may have a work around for this however, Oscar believes QA still needs this. Please speak with Oscar about this part of the card for more info.(note added 3/26/12)% h2. card.name: DEFECT: Simulcast Everywhere: Audio is clipping or cutting out intermittently
card.description:
h2. Describe the defect:
Audio on Simulcast Everywhere is clipping or cutting out intermittently. This happens nearly every sale, but seems more prevalent with todays’ sale. Sale number is 392. The stream number is 52. This is impacting our customer’s ability to participate in the sale. Please investigate.

card.name: Remove the cron job that cleans duplicate ListingEditLocks
card.description:
h2. Story Background
We have issues with the Listing Edit Lock changes made in release 110. One of our temporary fixes was to create a cron job that deletes duplicate listing_edit_lock rows (when there were duplicates, the app was throwing an error, and would not unlock any listings). This card is to track that cron job, and the fact that we need to remove after the ListingEditLock code is refactored. There is a script added to production, and a cron job that runs it, in ove-dc3prod-wrk01. Remove both from production, and the pre-production environments.
h2. Related Cards / Dependencies
The original card to track this problem was: "#19377":http://mingle.ove.local/projects/ove_2/cards/19377
h2. List of Dependencies
{{ dependency-tracker-project met: Status > 'Ready for Build' properties: [Type, Status, Iteration, Release] card-type: [Card, Defect] projects: [vicki, simulcast, lori, manheim_mobile, online_solutions_project, simev, dori] dependency-project: zz_dependency_tracker_project }}

card.name: IQD - Unable to Add listings to Event Sales on INV Manager Add to Event Sale Tab
card.description:
h2. Describe the defect:
Attempting to add listings to event sales fromt he inventory manager Add to Event Sale tab results in a "0 of 1 listings were successfully added to the Event Sale." message.
If you do to the same listings edit page, and attempt to add it to the same event sale, it will work successfully.
scenario inventory_manager.feature:52 in the automation suite should pass, if this were working properly. The scenario steps are below:
@ove_database @ove_database Scenario: Vin is Displayed in Add to Event Sale Tab Given I have a never listed listing And I am logged in as user "jmatas" And There is an OVE Event Sale When I add the listing to an event sale Then I should see "1 of 1 listings were successfully added to the Event Sale." on the inventory manager
h4. Site:
OVe - QA1
h4. Username/Password:
Jmatas/ Password
h4. VIN:
Any
h2. Steps to Reproduce: <Include screen names and actions>
# Log in as Jmatas and navigate to the inventory manager # Select Nissan Motor Acceptance Corp # Go to the Add to Event Sale Tab # Try to add any of the listings to an available event sale
h4. Actual Behavior:
the listing is not added to the event sale, and you are given the "0 of 1 listings were successfully added to the Event Sale." message.
h4. Expected Behavior:
The listing shoudl eb added to the event sale, and you should receive the "1 of 1 listings were successfully added to the Event Sale." message.
If you use the same listing and the same event sale, and attempt to add the listing to the event sale ont he edit listing page, it will work sucessfully.

card.name: Unblock sold vin results in page fault
card.description:
h2. Describe the defect:
When unblocking a sold vin, a page fault is displayed when the Unblock is confirmed. If you return to the list of 'Unblock' listings, the listing will show as having been successfully unblocked.
h4. Site:
OVE QA1
h4. Username/Password:
jmatas / password
h2. Steps to Reproduce: <Include screen names and actions>
# Login to OVE as jmatas # Select Unblock Sold VIN from the admin menu # Perform a search to obtain a list of sold listings # Click the Unblock link beside one of the listings # Enter a reason in the Enter Reason text box # Click the Confirm Unblock button
h4. Actual Behavior:
The action results in a page fault (see below) ElasticSearchable::ElasticError in UnblockController#confirmation
RemoteTransportException [[ove-dc4qa1-esrch01][inet[/10.141.65.124:9300]][index]]; nested: MapperParsingException[Failed to parse [title_status_id]]; nested: ElasticSearchIllegalArgumentException[unknown property [created_on]];
h4. Expected Behavior:
The listing should be successfully unblocked without a page fault.
h2. Screenshots:
!unblock_page_fault.png!

card.name: OVE Marketplace Trust

property.name: Project Manager

property.type_description: Automatically generated from the team list
property.name: Application Owner

card.name: IQD: QA1 - INV MGR: IE performance Issues
card.description:
QA follow up notes: Did more testing on UAT and Production using IE. Similar slowness in both environments when navigating between tabs was observed, although still useable. Did observe the problem on the Search for Account dialog in both environments, so that is already an issue prior to 111 release.
h2. Describe the defect: The performance of Inventory Manager when using IE8 browser is very slow. When logged in as an admin (jmatas) the main tab loads slowly and is barely acceptable.
But more significant problems were observed when navigating to other tabs, especially Send to AutoTrader is selected for Nissan Motor Acceptance Corp (over 8000 records). After a long login process to AutoTrader, the Inv Mgr page loads with no inventory - only the Add Inventory to AutoTrader buttons display. This would lead the user to believe that there is no inventory, but actually, the list is still loading (takes quite a while).
Another particulary problematic issue is observed when the Search for Account link is selected. In this case the search dialog displays but when the user clicks into the Account Name field and types there is a very delayed response. The user has no indication that his actions are being processed, and no text displays in the textbox until quite a bit later.
This was tested in UAT having 110 code (prior to Inv Mgr UI changes) and these issues were not observed. Also looked at QA2 where the performance was similar to QA1 (111 code).
h4. Site: QA1, IE8.0.7601.17514

property.type_description: Automatically generated from the team list
property.name: Analyst

property.type_description: Automatically generated from the team list
property.name: Tester

card.name: Perf: Investigate: Cache-Money Assessment
card.description:
Investigate how we're using cache-money.
* What is the ratio of gets to sets/adds for each model? ** If there are more gets, is that due to N+1 issues? * Tracy had concerns that Listing Hook calls such as #use_buyer_group_settings will cause queries to fire individually for listings instead of 1 big query for all listings.
Outcome of this card should be:
* An assessment of how effectively we're using this strategy of caching, and how it could be changed. * How much is CacheMoney affecting our performance in a good or bad way? * How bad would it be to remove this caching/safety net, how would we need to educate developers to not introduce more problems. * How long would it take us to remove Cache Money (utilizing another form of caching where needed)

card.name: Perf: Tracing/Logging: Add logging for Cache-Money for set and add
card.description:
We have added extra logging to Cache Money to allow us to investigate how we are using this caching strategy. We are not logging things such as 'set's to memcache using cache money. We will need to add this logging in order to better investigate how effectively we're using Cache Money.
h2. %{color:red}Talk to Sarah when you go to implement this card. She has an idea of where this logging should be added%

card.name: Defect: ARI Communication Error Emails
card.description:
h2. Describe the defect:
When OVE is unable to connect to ARI to send BOOK or FINALIZE ws messages, OVE attempts to send the messages 8 times (over approx 8 minutes) and then sends ARI an email informing ARI of the activity so ARI can manually manage the vehicle.
When regression testing this in QA2 (using stubbed version) the emails are not displaying an expected value but instead the "Ruby Code" that would be pulling the value. See examples below.
_Note: While this has likely been the case for a long time (probably since inception) and this even should rarely occur, with new changes that have been made for ARI Marketplace Expansion, it will be more important in the future that in the event of a failure we communicate the correct value (previously there was only 1 possible value, now there are 2 possible values so this will be more important that it was in the past._
h4. Site:
OVE QA2 (we assume this is the outcome in production)
h4. Username/Password:
h4. VIN: <where relevant>
h2. Steps to Reproduce: <Include screen names and actions>
# Deploy ari_gateway_stub in QA environment (deploy in a branch temporarily) # As a seller (like jmatas) Find or add a vehicle with VIN = UNEXPECTED and Ari ( Automotive Rentals Inc) as the account and activate the vehicle. Note: If adding a new vehicle is must also have a Stock Number for successful messaging. Mimic an existing Ari vehicle stock number example like 2H37. Set up for both bid & buy now. # As a buyer (like sonora) Place a bid on the vehicle # After about 10-15 minutes, check the webmail box. The BOOK error message should be generated. # As a buyer (like sonora) Buy now the vehicle # After about 10-15 minutes, check the webmail box. The FINALIZE error message should be generated.
h4. Actual Behavior:
The text in the message - the 2nd sentence on both the BOOK and finalize messages end in ....SDO Id %{color:red}ARI::Gateway::SDO_ID%. See Screenshots.
See [[ARI]] Error Handling section pulled from original story requests released 3/2011 if you would like more information
h4. Expected Behavior:
The text in the message - the 2nd sentence on both the BOOK and finalize messages end in ....SDO Id %{color:red}[VALUE% of Ari::Gateway::SDO_ID] - possible results would be....SDO Id %{color:red}AV6% (if not myCentral) or ....SDO id %{color:red}AV0% (if myCentral)
h2. Screenshots:
!http://mingle.ove.local/attachments_1/76b35b4786043aea75803fdeef57643d/101190/BOOK_Communication_Failure_Email_MyCentral.PNG!
!http://mingle.ove.local/attachments_1/66e7f5fd5579933f3849a363892c8df1/101191/FINALIZE_Communication_Failure_Email_MyCentral.PNG!
h3. Impact to Private Label Sites:

card.name: DEFECT: SD pictures not showing in listing
card.description:
h2. Describe the defect:
Pictures are not showing in this ove listing. They only show when you click on the SD itself. Listing was imported by an aggregator (cdemo) and got re-listed about 4 times. No failed images in ove but the pics just won't attach. I also see the images in listing_image_orders table in Ruby for the initial listing # 34790235 but nothing after that.
Different listing ids : 34790235 34791974 34792071 34907277 35003634 (live)
h4. Site: ove.com
h4. Username/Password: Any
h4. VIN: <where relevant>
5J6YH28553L021270
h2. Steps to Reproduce: <Include screen names and actions>
# Login to ove and look up vehicle through the search box tool # There won't be any pictures unless you click on SD
h4. Actual Behavior: Pictures not showing
h4. Expected Behavior: SD pictures should display in listing

card.name: RR: Upgrade to Rails 3.1
RR: Upgrade to Rails 3.0
RR: Remove/Replace CacheMoney
SimEv Admin: Create Bid History Report for each Sale
card.description:
h2. User Story As a SimEv Admin (Manheim Employee),
I want to see a the results for each sale
So that I can manage post-sale activities and analyze sale statistics for Clients
Additionally I would like to export this information to csv h2. Story Background SimEv Admin have been continually requesting this information from the application owner and would like a quick/consistent/ongoing method to obtain detailed information regarding SimEv sales. Additionally Nissan is asking for this post-sale information to understand the market better. h2. Related Cards / Dependencies http://mingle.ove.local/projects/ove_2/cards/17471 @{{ dependency-tracker-project met: Status > 'Ready for Build' properties: [Type, Status, Iteration, Release] card-type: [Card, Defect] projects: [vicki, simulcast, lori, manheim_mobile, online_solutions_project, simev, dori] dependency-project: zz_dependency_tracker_project }}@ h2. Out of Scope * List of Participants h2. Outstanding Questions: |_. No|_. Question|_. Answer|_. Notes| |1| How is it different from what we have now?|%{color:blue}Today we don’t have this kind of reporting for SimEv. We have some things that break out this information per vehicle or in a certain situation, but we don’t have resources that our team can reference after a sale is over.%|-| |2| Are there any specific Live Sale reports today? |%{color:blue}There is one that we created with data services – a bid and sale report.%|-| |3| Who is it for?|%{color:blue}It was mainly recreated for Nissan but we provide it for other sellers when they ask for it.%|-| |4| Who is new report - Admins only?|%{color:blue}This new report will be for v6 admins only and I envision it will live inside the SimEv sale management section.%|-| |5| Sellers and Admin only?|%{color:blue}No, though the information may ultimately be shared with a seller.%|-| |6| Buyers (for bid history)?|%{color:blue}No%|-| |7| What format do they want it in?|%{color:blue}On screen to start, in a format that could be copied if it needed to. Future enhancements as excel export.%|-| |8| Should it be visible on the page as well as downloadable report?|%{color:blue}I’d prefer it to be.%|-| |9| Where should this info be located?|-|-| |10| What do we mean by 'participants' - the people who bid on a given vehicle, or everyone who was in the sale at any given point?|-|-| h2. Narrative * Create a report title "Bid History" and should contain much of the same data as on the bid history page on SimEv such as: ** Seller ** Seller # - is this the seller universal id? ** VIN ** Run # ** Buyer (Dealership) ** Buyer contact First Name & Last Name ** Bid Amount ** Indicate which bid was the winning bid * What is the sort order for this? * Suggest doing a mock-up of the information in excel for the 'csv version' and running past veronica to confirm fields * Then work with Kim Morton to design the on-screen view of the "report" h2. card.name: Perf: Investigate Spikes in New Relic Request Queuing
card.description:
h2. Story Background
Investigate spikes in request queuing that are reported through New Relic. Examples of spikes can be seen while Keith was querying the db around 1:30 am on 10 April 2013.
h2. Dev Notes (Jonathan & Derek 10 April 2013)
* Added "newrelic-middleware gem":https://github.com/twinturbo/newrelic-middleware to branch "tracking_middlewares_in_new_relic" ** Through logging we noticed we were accessing the init and call methods of the gem, but did not see any middleware tracing in new relic.

card.name: Op Husbandry: Request Facilitation Criteria - Add buyer group as criteria to halt the request facilitation process
card.description:
h2. User Story There is a set of buyer groups (Trade Network closed for Hendrick & Sam Swope) - dealers find vehicles online & basically swap between themselves. Manheim doesn't facilitate the exchange of funds. It's clumsy getting these vehicles into central auction's inventory, they just end up having to close out alot of things that aren't real. So....if we could turn off the facilitation for Dealer Trade Network closed buyer group, we would eliminate these issues. h2. Related Cards / Dependencies h2. Narrative Add a value to the request facilitation criteria: buyer group. Allow any combination of live sale, fsp, account, buyer group. This will halt the facilitation of a sale to the as400 if the listing has the existing combination of these attributes. h2. Sample Screen Shots h2. Acceptance Criteria |_. No.|_. Given |_. When |_. Then|_. Comments|_. Status| |1|as a user on ove.com, I buy a vehicle from a manheim auction| there is no request facilitation criteria matching my listing|the request facilitation request is created for the sale|-| |2|as a user on ove.com, I buy a vehicle from a manheim auction| there is request facilitation criteria matching my listing for buyer group (Dealer Trade Network closed)|NO request facilitation request is created for the sale|-| h2. Estimation Assumptions h2. Dev Tasks: Have you thought about: # Impact on performance # Does this need a separate monitoring solution # Does this impact reporting (changing/moving database info) # Do we need something from another team to implement/test this? p((. Include new Database name columns h2. Automation Tasks h2. Questions |_. No.|_. Date|_. Question|_. Answer| |1|-|What are the objectives/metrics the business will use to evaluate?|-| h2.
